item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Friday, February 7, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Gleam v1.8.0 released (33 points | 4 comments)
2. CPython tail-call interpreter merged for Python 3.14, a 10% speedup in benchmarks (21 points | 11 comments)
3. You Didn't Notice MP3 Is Now Free (40 points | 22 comments)
4. Comments on Shared Unix Hosting vs. the Cloud (22 points | 32 comments)
5. What are you doing this weekend? (10 points | 16 comments)
6. Asdf Version Manager Has Been Re-Written in Golang (59 points | 37 comments)
7. Refined: simple refinement types for Rust (6 points | 1 comment)
8. numbat: A statically typed programming language for scientific computations with first class support for physical dimensions and units (14 points | 3 comments)
9. Fun Friday: what's the weirdest automation you've ever made? (3 points | 6 comments)
10. FOSDEM 2025 - 14 Years of systemd (13 points | 2 comments)
11. HTML Whitespace is Broken (47 points | 32 comments)
12. The Three Projections of Doctor Futamura (16 points | 5 comments)
13. getaddrinfo sucks. everything else is much worse (3 points | no comments)
14. It Is Time to Standardize Principles and Practices for Software Memory Safety (42 points | 22 comments)
15. The LLM Curve of Impact on Software Engineers (5 points | 2 comments)
16. Cloudflare incident on February 6, 2025 (3 points | 1 comment)
17. A Brief History of Code Signing at Mozilla (3 points | no comments)
18. polysubml-demo: A simple ML-like language with subtyping, polymorphism, higher rank types, and global type inference (3 points | no comments)
19. DOOM running on Apple Lightning to HDMI dongle (19 points | 5 comments)
20. OpenWrt 24.10.0 - First Stable Release (14 points | 4 comments)
21. CODE beyond FAIR (1 points | no comments)
22. Updating a large codebase to Rust 2024 (18 points | no comments)
23. A Decade of TILs (6 points | 3 comments)
24. String vs &str (34 points | 43 comments)
25. Secure cookie library in Go from scratch (1 points | no comments)
